message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the problem of simplifying a polygon by minimizing the number of convex corners, which is a fundamental problem in computational geometry. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the complexity analysis of the problem, which suggests that it could belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The use of graph theory and combinatorics in the paper also makes cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper involves some game-theoretic arguments, which could make it relevant to cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
